page.title: 18ECOLOGY IN TODDINGTON
page.content: Many of the footpaths studied were found to be in good order with new plantings of saplings. The flora and fauna of these walks was considerable The{streams}under observation were found to contain vast quantities of water plants and creatures. Many areas of the streams were free flowing and clear. Effluent and chemical{pollution was hardly in evidence though litter and metal rubbish were common place in most areas.{Hedgerows}were found in pleasing conditions being either left to naturalise or being well maintained and often layered. Many different types of bird life and insects were observed. Plant life was most abundant and tree life was found to consist heavily of Ash, Maple and Hawthorn. After testing, the plant life was found to be supported by a neutral type soil.
